intro: Alloplectus grisebachianus, commonly known as the gray-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in arid regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
